members.member:
This static method will create an "allow everyone full control" single ACE DACL.
whether it is a DS DACL whether it is a container The single ACE DACL Note: This method is created to get the best behavior for using "allow everyone full access" single ACE DACL to replace null DACL from CommonSecurityObject.

member.name: P:System.Security.AccessControl.ObjectSecurity.SecurityDescriptor
member.summary: Gets the security descriptor for this instance.

member.name: T:System.Security.AccessControl.Privilege
member.summary: Managed wrapper for NT privileges

member.name: P:System.NotImplemented.ByDesign
member.summary: Permanent NotImplementedException with no message shown to user.

member.name: M:System.NotImplemented.ByDesignWithMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Permanent NotImplementedException with localized message shown to user.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_AclTooLong
member.summary: Length of the access control list exceed the allowed maximum.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_InvalidAccessRuleType
member.summary: The access rule is not the correct type.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_InvalidAuditRuleType
member.summary: The audit rule is not the correct type.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_InvalidOwner
member.summary: The security identifier is not allowed to be the owner of this object.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_InvalidGroup
member.summary: The security identifier is not allowed to be the primary group of this object.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_InvalidHandle
member.summary: The supplied handle is invalid. This can happen when trying to set an ACL on an anonymous kernel object.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_InvalidSecurityDescriptorRevision
member.summary: Security descriptor with revision other than '1' are not legal.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_InvalidSecurityDescriptorSelfRelativeForm
member.summary: Security descriptor must be in the self-relative form.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_InvalidSidInSDDLString
member.summary: The SDDL string contains an invalid sid or a sid that cannot be translated.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_MustSpecifyContainerAcl
member.summary: The named parameter must be a container ACL.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_MustSpecifyDirectoryObjectAcl
member.summary: The named parameter must be a directory-object ACL.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_MustSpecifyLeafObjectAcl
member.summary: The named parameter must be a non-container ACL.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_MustSpecifyNonDirectoryObjectAcl
member.summary: The named parameter must be a non-directory-object ACL.

member.name: P:System.SR.AccessControl_NoAssociatedSecurity
member.summary: Unable to perform a security operation on an object that has no associated security. This can happen when trying to get an ACL of an anonymous kernel object.

member.summary: Method failed with unexpected error code {0}.

member.summary: Must set at least one flag.

member.summary: Illegal enum value: {0}.

member.summary: Operation is not valid due to the current state of the object.

member.summary: Argument cannot be zero.

member.summary: No flags can be set.

member.summary: Destination array is not long enough to copy all the required data. Check array length and offset.

member.summary: Enum value was out of legal range.

member.name: P:System.SR.PlatformNotSupported_AccessControl
member.summary: Access Control List (ACL) APIs are part of resource management on Windows and are not supported on this platform.
